Variable.name: A_AhkPath
Variable.description: For non-compiled or embedded scripts: The full path and name of the EXE file that is actually running the current script. For compiled scripts based on a .bin file, the value is determined by reading the installation directory from the registry and appending "\AutoHotkey.exe". If AutoHotkey is not installed, the value is blank. The example below is equivalent:

Variable.name: A_AhkVersion
Variable.description: Contains the version of AutoHotkey that is running the script, such as 1.0.22. In the case of a compiled script, the version that was originally used to compile it is reported. The formatting of the version number allows a script to check whether A_AhkVersion is greater than some minimum version number with > or >= as in this example: if (A_AhkVersion >= "1.0.25.07"). See also: #Requires and VerCompare

Variable.name: A_AllowMainWindow
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set whether the script's main window is allowed to be opened via the tray icon. Possible values are 0 (forbidden) and 1 (allowed).

Variable.name: A_AppData
Variable.description: The full path and name of the folder containing the current user's application-specific data. For example:

Variable.name: A_AppDataCommon
Variable.description: The full path and name of the folder containing the all-users application-specific data. For example:

Variable.name: A_Args
Variable.description: Contains an array of command line parameters. For details, see Passing Command Line Parameters to a Script.

Variable.name: A_Clipboard
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the contents of the OS's clipboard. For details, see A_Clipboard.

Variable.name: A_ComputerName
Variable.description: The name of the computer as seen on the network.

Variable.name: A_ComSpec
Variable.description: Contains the same string as the ComSpec environment variable, which is usually the full path to the command prompt executable (cmd.exe). Often used with Run/RunWait. For example:

Variable.name: A_ControlDelay
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the delay for control-modifying functions, in milliseconds. For details, see SetControlDelay.

Variable.name: A_CoordModeCaret
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the area to which coordinates are to be relative. Possible values are Screen, Window, and Client. For details, see CoordMode.

Variable.name: A_CoordModeMenu
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the area to which coordinates are to be relative. Possible values are Screen, Window, and Client. For details, see CoordMode.

Variable.name: A_CoordModeMouse
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the area to which coordinates are to be relative. Possible values are Screen, Window, and Client. For details, see CoordMode.

Variable.name: A_CoordModePixel
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the area to which coordinates are to be relative. Possible values are Screen, Window, and Client. For details, see CoordMode.

Variable.name: A_CoordModeToolTip
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the area to which coordinates are to be relative. Possible values are Screen, Window, and Client. For details, see CoordMode.

Variable.name: A_Cursor
Variable.description: The type of mouse cursor currently being displayed. It will be one of the following words: AppStarting, Arrow, Cross, Help, IBeam, Icon, No, Size, SizeAll, SizeNESW, SizeNS, SizeNWSE, SizeWE, UpArrow, Wait, Unknown. The acronyms used with the size-type cursors are compass directions, e.g. NESW = NorthEast+SouthWest. The hand-shaped cursors (pointing and grabbing) are classified as Unknown.

Variable.name: A_DD
Variable.description: Current 2-digit day of the month (01-31). Synonymous with A_MDay.

Variable.name: A_DDD
Variable.description: Current day of the week's abbreviation in the current user's language, e.g. Sun

Variable.name: A_DDDD
Variable.description: Current day of the week's full name in the current user's language, e.g. Sunday

Variable.name: A_DefaultMouseSpeed
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the default mouse speed, an integer from 0 (fastest) to 100 (slowest). For details, see SetDefaultMouseSpeed.

Variable.name: A_Desktop
Variable.description: The full path and name of the folder containing the current user's desktop files. For example:

Variable.name: A_DesktopCommon
Variable.description: The full path and name of the folder containing the all-users desktop files. For example:

Variable.name: A_DetectHiddenText
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set whether to detect hidden text in a window. Possible values are 0 (disabled) and 1 (enabled). For details, see DetectHiddenText.

Variable.name: A_DetectHiddenWindows
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set whether to detect hidden windows. Possible values are 0 (disabled) and 1 (enabled). For details, see DetectHiddenWindows.

Variable.name: A_EndChar
Variable.description: The ending character that was pressed by the user to trigger the most recent non-auto-replace hotstring. If no ending character was required (due to the * option), this variable will be blank.

Variable.name: A_EventInfo
Variable.description: Contains additional information about the following events: Mouse wheel hotkeys (WheelDown/Up/Left/Right), OnMessage, Regular Expression Callouts.

Variable.name: A_FileEncoding
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the default encoding for various built-in functions. For details, see FileEncoding.

Variable.name: A_HotkeyInterval
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the length of the interval used by A_MaxHotkeysPerInterval, in milliseconds.

Variable.name: A_HotkeyModifierTimeout
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the timeout affecting the behavior of Send with hotkey modifiers Ctrl, Alt, Win, and Shift. For details, see A_HotkeyModifierTimeout.

Variable.name: A_Hour
Variable.description: Current 2-digit hour (00-23) in 24-hour time (for example, 17 is 5pm). To retrieve 12-hour time as well as an AM/PM indicator, follow this example: FormatTime(, "h:mm:ss tt")

Variable.name: A_IconFile
Variable.description: Blank unless a custom tray icon has been specified via TraySetIcon -- in which case it is the full path and name of the icon's file.

Variable.name: A_IconHidden
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set whether to hide the tray icon. Possible values are 0 (visible) and 1 (hidden). For details, see #NoTrayIcon.

Variable.name: A_IconNumber
Variable.description: Blank if A_IconFile is blank. Otherwise, it's the number of the icon in A_IconFile (typically 1).

Variable.name: A_IconTip
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the tray icon's tooltip text, which is displayed when the mouse hovers over it. If blank, the script's name is used instead.

Variable.name: A_Index
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the number of the current loop iteration (a 64-bit integer). It contains 1 the first time the loop's body is executed. For the second time, it contains 2; and so on. If an inner loop is enclosed by an outer loop, the inner loop takes precedence. A_Index works inside all types of loops, but contains 0 outside of a loop. For counted loops such as Loop, changing A_Index affects the number of iterations that will be performed.

Variable.name: A_InitialWorkingDir
Variable.description: The script's initial working directory, which is determined by how it was launched. For example, if it was run via shortcut -- such as on the Start Menu -- its initial working directory is determined by the "Start in" field within the shortcut's properties.

Variable.name: A_Is64bitOS
Variable.description: Contains 1 (true) if the OS is 64-bit or 0 (false) if it is 32-bit.

Variable.name: A_IsAdmin
Variable.description: Contains 1 if the current user has admin rights, otherwise 0.

Variable.name: A_IsCompiled
Variable.description: Contains 1 if the script is running as a compiled EXE and 0 (which is considered false) if it is not.

Variable.name: A_IsCritical
Variable.description: Contains 0 if Critical is off for the current thread. Otherwise it contains an integer greater than zero, namely the message-check interval being used by Critical. The current state of Critical can be saved and restored via Old_IsCritical := A_IsCritical followed later by A_IsCritical := Old_IsCritical.

Variable.name: A_IsPaused
Variable.description: Contains 1 if the thread immediately underneath the current thread is paused, otherwise 0.

Variable.name: A_IsSuspended
Variable.description: Contains 1 if the script is suspended, otherwise 0.

Variable.name: A_KeyDelay
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the delay or duration for keystrokes, in milliseconds. For details, see SetKeyDelay.

Variable.name: A_KeyDelayPlay
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the delay or duration for keystrokes sent via SendPlay mode, in milliseconds. For details, see SetKeyDelay.

Variable.name: A_KeyDuration
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the delay or duration for keystrokes, in milliseconds. For details, see SetKeyDelay.

Variable.name: A_KeyDurationPlay
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the delay or duration for keystrokes sent via SendPlay mode, in milliseconds. For details, see SetKeyDelay.

Variable.name: A_Language
Variable.description: The system's default language, which is one of these 4-digit codes.

Variable.name: A_LastError
Variable.description: This is usually the result from the OS's GetLastError() function after the script calls certain functions, including DllCall, Run/RunWait, File/Ini/Reg functions (where documented) and possibly others. A_LastError is a number between 0 and 4294967295 (always formatted as decimal, not hexadecimal). Zero (0) means success, but any other number means the call failed. Each number corresponds to a specific error condition. See OSError for how to get the localized error description text, or search www.microsoft.com for "system error codes" to get a list. A_LastError is a per-thread setting; that is, interruptions by other threads cannot change it.

Variable.name: A_LineFile
Variable.description: The full path and name of the file to which A_LineNumber belongs. If the script was loaded from an external file, this is the same as A_ScriptFullPath unless the line belongs to one of the script's #Include files.

Variable.name: A_LineNumber
Variable.description: The number of the currently executing line within the script (or one of its #Include files). This line number will match the one shown by ListLines; it can be useful for error reporting such as this example: MsgBox "Could not write to log file (line number " A_LineNumber ")".

Variable.name: A_ListLines
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set whether to log lines. Possible values are 0 (disabled) and 1 (enabled). For details, see ListLines.

Variable.name: A_LoopField
Variable.description: It contains the contents of the current substring (field). If an inner parsing loop is enclosed by an outer parsing loop, the innermost loop's field will take precedence.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileAttrib
Variable.description: The attributes of the file currently retrieved.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileDir
Variable.description: The path of the directory in which A_LoopFileName resides. If FilePattern contains a relative path rather than an absolute path, the path here will also be relative. A root directory will not contain a trailing backslash. For example: C:

Variable.name: A_LoopFileExt
Variable.description: The file's extension (e.g. TXT, DOC, or EXE). The period (.) is not included.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileFullPath
Variable.description: This is different than A_LoopFilePath in the following ways: 1) It always contains the absolute/complete path of the file even if FilePattern contains a relative path; 2) Any short (8.3) folder names in FilePattern itself are converted to their long names; 3) Characters in FilePattern are converted to uppercase or lowercase to match the case stored in the file system. This is useful for converting file names -- such as those passed into a script as command line parameters -- to their exact path names as shown by Explorer.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileName
Variable.description: The name of the file or folder currently retrieved (without the path).

Variable.name: A_LoopFilePath
Variable.description: The path and name of the file/folder currently retrieved. If FilePattern contains a relative path rather than an absolute path, the path here will also be relative. In addition, any short (8.3) folder names in FilePattern will still be short (see next item to get the long version).

Variable.name: A_LoopFileShortName
Variable.description: The 8.3 short name or alternate name of the file. If the file doesn't have one (due to the long name being shorter than 8.3 or perhaps because short-name generation is disabled on an NTFS file system), A_LoopFileName will be retrieved instead.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileShortPath
Variable.description: The 8.3 short path and name of the file/folder currently retrieved. For example: C:\MYDOCU~1\ADDRES~1.txt. If FilePattern contains a relative path rather than an absolute path, the path here will also be relative.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileSize
Variable.description: The size in bytes of the file currently retrieved. Files larger than 4 gigabytes are also supported.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileSizeKB
Variable.description: The size in Kbytes of the file currently retrieved, rounded down to the nearest integer.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileSizeMB
Variable.description: The size in Mbytes of the file currently retrieved, rounded down to the nearest integer.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileTimeAccessed
Variable.description: The time the file was last accessed. Format YYYYMMDDHH24MISS.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileTimeCreated
Variable.description: The time the file was created. Format YYYYMMDDHH24MISS.

Variable.name: A_LoopFileTimeModified
Variable.description: The time the file was last modified. Format YYYYMMDDHH24MISS.

Variable.name: A_LoopReadLine
Variable.description: It contains the contents of the current line excluding the carriage return and linefeed (`r`n) that marks the end of the line.

Variable.name: A_LoopRegKey
Variable.description: full name of the key which contains the current loop item. For remote registry access, this value will not include the computer name.

Variable.name: A_LoopRegName
Variable.description: of the currently retrieved item, which can be either a value name or the name of a subkey. Value names displayed by Windows RegEdit as "(Default)" will be retrieved if a value has been assigned to them, but A_LoopRegName will be blank for them.

Variable.name: A_LoopRegTimeModified
Variable.description: time the current subkey or any of its values was last modified. Format YYYYMMDDHH24MISS. This variable will be empty if the currently retrieved item is not a subkey (i.e. A_LoopRegType is not the word KEY).

Variable.name: A_LoopRegType
Variable.description: type of the currently retrieved item, which is one of the following words: KEY (i.e. the currently retrieved item is a subkey not a value), REG_SZ, REG_EXPAND_SZ, REG_MULTI_SZ, REG_DWORD, REG_QWORD, REG_BINARY, REG_LINK, REG_RESOURCE_LIST, REG_FULL_RESOURCE_DESCRIPTOR, REG_RESOURCE_REQUIREMENTS_LIST, REG_DWORD_BIG_ENDIAN (probably rare on most Windows hardware). It will be empty if the currently retrieved item is of an unknown type.

Variable.name: A_MaxHotkeysPerInterval
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the maximum number of hotkeys that can be pressed within the interval defined by A_HotkeyInterval without triggering a warning dialog. For details, see A_MaxHotkeysPerInterval.

Variable.name: A_MenuMaskKey
Variable.description: Controls which key is used to mask Win or Alt keyup events. For details, see A_MenuMaskKey.

Variable.name: A_Min
Variable.description: Current 2-digit minute (00-59).

Variable.name: A_MM
Variable.description: Current 2-digit month (01-12). Synonymous with A_Mon.

Variable.name: A_MMM
Variable.description: Current month's abbreviation in the current user's language, e.g. Jul

Variable.name: A_MMMM
Variable.description: Current month's full name in the current user's language, e.g. July

Variable.name: A_MouseDelay
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the mouse delay, in milliseconds. A_MouseDelay is for the traditional SendEvent mode, whereas A_MouseDelayPlay is for SendPlay. For details, see SetMouseDelay.

Variable.name: A_MouseDelayPlay
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the mouse delay, in milliseconds. A_MouseDelay is for the traditional SendEvent mode, whereas A_MouseDelayPlay is for SendPlay. For details, see SetMouseDelay.

Variable.name: A_MSec
Variable.description: Current 3-digit millisecond (000-999). To remove the leading zeros, follow this example: Milliseconds := A_MSec + 0.

Variable.name: A_MyDocuments
Variable.description: The full path and name of the current user's "My Documents" folder. Unlike most of the similar variables, if the folder is the root of a drive, the final backslash is not included (e.g. it would contain M: rather than M:\). For example:

Variable.name: A_Now
Variable.description: The current local time in YYYYMMDDHH24MISS format.

Variable.name: A_NowUTC
Variable.description: The current Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) in YYYYMMDDHH24MISS format. UTC is essentially the same as Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

Variable.name: A_OSVersion
Variable.description: The version number of the operating system, in the format "major.minor.build". For example, Windows 7 SP1 is 6.1.7601.

Variable.name: A_PriorHotkey
Variable.description: Same as above except for the previous hotkey. It will be blank if none.

Variable.name: A_PriorKey
Variable.description: The name of the last key which was pressed prior to the most recent key-press or key-release, or blank if no applicable key-press can be found in the key history. All input generated by AutoHotkey scripts is excluded. For this variable to be of use, the keyboard or mouse hook must be installed and key history must be enabled.

Variable.name: A_ProgramFiles
Variable.description: The Program Files directory (e.g. C:\Program Files or C:\Program Files (x86)). This is usually the same as the ProgramFiles environment variable.

Variable.name: A_Programs
Variable.description: The full path and name of the Programs folder in the current user's Start Menu. For example:

Variable.name: A_ProgramsCommon
Variable.description: The full path and name of the Programs folder in the all-users Start Menu. For example:

Variable.name: A_PtrSize
Variable.description: Contains the size of a pointer, in bytes. This is either 4 (32-bit) or 8 (64-bit), depending on what type of executable (EXE) is running the script.

Variable.name: A_RegView
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the registry view. Possible values are 32, 64 and Default. For details, see SetRegView.

Variable.name: A_ScreenDPI
Variable.description: Number of pixels per logical inch along the screen width. In a system with multiple display monitors, this value is the same for all monitors. On most systems this is 96; it depends on the system's text size (DPI) setting. See also the GUI's -DPIScale option.

Variable.name: A_ScreenHeight
Variable.description: The height of the primary monitor, in pixels.

Variable.name: A_ScreenWidth
Variable.description: The width of the primary monitor, in pixels.

Variable.name: A_ScriptDir
Variable.description: The full path of the directory where the current script is located. The final backslash is omitted (even for root directories).

Variable.name: A_ScriptFullPath
Variable.description: The full path of the current script, e.g. C:\Scripts\My Script.ahk

Variable.name: A_ScriptHwnd
Variable.description: The unique ID (HWND/handle) of the script's hidden main window.

Variable.name: A_ScriptName
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the default title for MsgBox, InputBox, FileSelect, DirSelect and Gui. If not set by the script, it defaults to the file name of the current script, without its path, e.g. MyScript.ahk.

Variable.name: A_Sec
Variable.description: Current 2-digit second (00-59).

Variable.name: A_SendLevel
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the send level, an integer from 0 to 100. For details, see SendLevel.

Variable.name: A_SendMode
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the send mode. Possible values are Event, Input, Play, and InputThenPlay. For details, see SendMode.

Variable.name: A_Space
Variable.description: Contains a single space character.

Variable.name: A_StartMenu
Variable.description: The full path and name of the current user's Start Menu folder. For example:

Variable.name: A_StartMenuCommon
Variable.description: The full path and name of the all-users Start Menu folder. For example:

Variable.name: A_Startup
Variable.description: The full path and name of the Startup folder in the current user's Start Menu. For example:

Variable.name: A_StartupCommon
Variable.description: The full path and name of the Startup folder in the all-users Start Menu. For example:

Variable.name: A_StoreCapsLockMode
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set whether to restore the state of CapsLock after a Send. Possible values are 0 (disabled) and 1 (enabled). For details, see SetStoreCapsLockMode.

Variable.name: A_Tab
Variable.description: Contains a single tab character.

Variable.name: A_Temp
Variable.description: The full path and name of the folder designated to hold temporary files. It is retrieved from one of the following locations (in order): 1) the environment variables TMP, TEMP, or USERPROFILE; 2) the Windows directory. For example:

Variable.name: A_ThisFunc
Variable.description: The name of the user-defined function that is currently executing (blank if none); for example: MyFunction. See also: Name property (Func)

Variable.name: A_ThisHotkey
Variable.description: The most recently executed hotkey or non-auto-replace hotstring (blank if none), e.g. #z. This value will change if the current thread is interrupted by another hotkey or hotstring, so it is generally better to use the parameter ThisHotkey when available.

Variable.name: A_TickCount
Variable.description: The number of milliseconds that have elapsed since the system was started, up to 49.7 days. By storing A_TickCount in a variable, elapsed time can later be measured by subtracting that variable from the latest A_TickCount value. For example:

Variable.name: A_TimeIdle
Variable.description: The number of milliseconds that have elapsed since the system last received keyboard, mouse, or other input. This is useful for determining whether the user is away. Physical input from the user as well as artificial input generated by any program or script (such as the Send or MouseMove functions) will reset this value back to zero. Since this value tends to increase by increments of 10, do not check whether it is equal to another value. Instead, check whether it is greater or less than another value. For example:

Variable.name: A_TimeIdleKeyboard
Variable.description: If the keyboard hook is installed, this is the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since the system last received physical keyboard input. Otherwise, this variable is equivalent to A_TimeIdle.

Variable.name: A_TimeIdleMouse
Variable.description: If the mouse hook is installed, this is the number of milliseconds that have elapsed since the system last received physical mouse input. Otherwise, this variable is equivalent to A_TimeIdle.

Variable.name: A_TimeIdlePhysical
Variable.description: Similar to above but ignores artificial keystrokes and/or mouse clicks whenever the corresponding hook (keyboard or mouse) is installed; that is, it responds only to physical events. (This prevents simulated keystrokes and mouse clicks from falsely indicating that a user is present.) If neither hook is installed, this variable is equivalent to A_TimeIdle. If only one hook is installed, only its type of physical input affects A_TimeIdlePhysical (the other/non-installed hook's input, both physical and artificial, has no effect).

Variable.name: A_TimeSincePriorHotkey
Variable.description: The number of milliseconds that have elapsed since A_PriorHotkey was pressed. It will be blank whenever A_PriorHotkey is blank.

Variable.name: A_TimeSinceThisHotkey
Variable.description: The number of milliseconds that have elapsed since A_ThisHotkey was pressed. It will be blank whenever A_ThisHotkey is blank.

Variable.name: A_TitleMatchMode
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the title match mode. Possible values are 1, 2, 3, and RegEx. For details, see SetTitleMatchMode.

Variable.name: A_TitleMatchModeSpeed
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the title match speed. Possible values are Fast and Slow. For details, see SetTitleMatchMode.

Variable.name: A_TrayMenu
Variable.description: Returns a Menu object which can be used to modify or display the tray menu.

Variable.name: A_UserName
Variable.description: The logon name of the user who launched this script.

Variable.name: A_WDay
Variable.description: Current 1-digit day of the week (1-7). 1 is Sunday in all locales.

Variable.name: A_WinDelay
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the delay for windowing functions, in milliseconds. For details, see SetWinDelay.

Variable.name: A_WinDir
Variable.description: The Windows directory. For example: C:\Windows

Variable.name: A_WorkingDir
Variable.description: Can be used to get or set the script's current working directory, which is where files will be accessed by default. The final backslash is not included unless it is the root directory. Two examples: C:\ and C:\My Documents.

Variable.name: A_YDay
Variable.description: Current day of the year (1-366). The value is not zero-padded, e.g. 9 is retrieved, not 009. To retrieve a zero-padded value, use the following: FormatTime(, "YDay0").

Variable.name: A_YWeek
Variable.description: Current year and week number (e.g. 200453) according to ISO 8601. To separate the year from the week, use Year := SubStr(A_YWeek, 1, 4) and Week := SubStr(A_YWeek, -2). Precise definition of A_YWeek: If the week containing January 1st has four or more days in the new year, it is considered week 1. Otherwise, it is the last week of the previous year, and the next week is week 1.

Variable.name: A_YYYY
Variable.description: Current 4-digit year (e.g. 2004). Synonymous with A_Year.

Variable.name: False
Variable.description: Contain 0. Can be used to make a script more readable. For details, see Boolean Values.

Variable.name: True
Variable.description: Contain 1. Can be used to make a script more readable. For details, see Boolean Values.
